quiz_list.question: A set of intructions that tells the computer how to behave, what to do and derive at a solution to a particular problem is:
A set of logically sequenced instructions that allows to find the solution to a problem is:
The six stages of program development in logical order are:

answerList.ans: Define, Analyze, Write, Test, Document, Debug
Define, Analyze, Develop, Write, Test and Debug, Document
Define, Write, Develop, Analyze, Test, Document
Define, Develop, Write, Test, Document, Debug

quiz_list.question: The programming language that is used to show pupils the concept and structure of programming is called:
Java is an example of which generation programming language:
Which of the following generations of programming language executed code faster:
Algorithms must be all of the following except:
Which language had codes such as MOV, ADD, SUB?
Which of the following had executes programming codes line by line, rather than the whole program:
All the following are examples of third programming language except:
Which of the following provides a reuse mechanism?
Which of the following is not a type of constructor?
Which of the following type of class allows only one object of it to be created?
What happens if the base and derived class contains definition of a function with same prototype?

answerList.ans: Compiler reports an error on compilation.
Only base class function will get called irrespective of object.
Only derived class function will get called irrespective of object.
Base class object will call base class function and derived class object will call derived class function.

quiz_list.question: Which of the following operator is overloaded for object cout?
